19.m: Let us hold fast the confession of our hope without wavering, for he who promised is faithful. - Hebrews 10:23 (ESV)

l.q: What is the limitation of sacrifices and offerings?
l.a: Sacrifices and offerings are not able to make the people perfectly free from sin. They have to be done everytime people commit sin and guilt.

l.q: Who has rendered the perfect sacrifice for us sinners?
l.a: Jesus Christ had offered for all time a single sacrifice for our sins.

l.q: In verses 19-22, what is the significance of Christ's death on the cross?
l.a: Jesus' death on the cross cleansed us of our sins. In him we have a great priest over the house of God and we have obtained God's forgiveness. And we can now draw near to God in full assurance of faith.

19.p: Lord God, I am constantly exposed to new ideas and thinking that may not necessarily align with your will and your teachings. Instead of animal sacrifices, Jesus Christ became our ultimate sacrifice. Grant me the grace to trust in you alone and not be once again swayed by traditions or practices that run contrary to your will. Jesus Christ alone is my savior. Lord, you, who promised, is faithful.
